title: Sure is fun getting held hostage by chimps, least I can try and pad my stats in the meantime
body:
Fucking idiots need to learn how to surrender

Oh we have 3 open inhibs and haven't even taken a single enemy tower? Nah you're right, we got this in the bag

I fucking hate these types of people

replies.body:
If I don't like your attitude, I'm not going to surrender. If you're acting like how you are now, than I'm most certainly not going to surrender.

Edit: Good to be back Boards. 

Edit 2: I mean like really, are people really defending this type of behavior? Calling other players "Fucking idiots" because they want to play the game? The dude's selfish, he doesn't care about how others feel about the game, he only cares about how he is enjoying the game. Like Anagram said, one person can't stop a surrender vote. Obviously people feel the game is worth playing.
"I'm going to waste my time just to keep someone in a game because I don't like their attitude"

He probably still wants to play. Surrendering for ONE player is a favour, not an obligation. If OP's going to be a jerk, why do him the favour?

Remember, this guy's complaining that the REST of the team won't surrender. At least 2/5ths. His opinion isn't > team opinion.

but you are wasting your own time as well "just to stick it to someone". Ill never understand why people devalue their own time just to screw other people's time as well. Its like laughing at the OP but really you are laughing at your self. If i dont like someone i'd rather ff the game and not see them again rather than sit there for 10m-20m to lose anyways and be stuck with that person the whole time while i could of been in another game.

If you're calling people idiots, I don't think you deserve an easy out of a losing game. You agreed to play to the best of your ability until the match is over, and that means putting forth your best attitude the entire game. Learn to lose graciously, like a good sport, and I'm all for ending it early, but act as aggressive and rude as the OP doesn't earn you any favors in my book.
and you are a  tool just as much as the person pissed for their teammates not surrendering. grow the hell up

Maybe I should, but when I see angry assholes who want to surrender at 9 minutes in, I don't care how they feel. I want to play the game, so excuse me for not wanting to surrender the moment *someone else* gives up.

It's possible to enjoy the game, and have fun, even while losing. If you resort to insulting people because they can have fun in ways other than winning, be it joking with the enemy team, or just wanting practice with their champ, I don't think you deserve an easy out. I'm all for an surrendering if the person has a good attitude, but I don't cave to assholes.

> I want to play the game

In the game he described? Yes, buy item, run from base, die within 30 seconds of just clearing all three minion waves pushing, get killed by anyone on enemy team being able to kill you due to their feed and your lack of gold unless you are camping your base, wait minute of grey screen, repeat several times. "Playing".

Nah don't mind them. I know exactly where you're coming from. I would have done the same thing if I see a teammate frustrated and be a dlck because they think they have the right to be for some reason. Not gonna use the word discipline, but at least keeping them in the game without surrendering would show them that not everyone agrees with them and a team revolves around more than one teammate. Plus, sometimes a good comeback does happen to teams not giving and it feels much more satisfying than easy wins.
So you're purposely trying to anger your team mate? That sounds a lot like trolling...

I'm not. I'm playing the game to the best of my ability, and putting forth my best attitude about it. If you're calling people idiots for not wanting to surrender, because god forbid they don't share your opinion, than you deserve to sit through a losing match.
"I'm going to do this just to anger you"

> "I can make up fake quotes that only push my point of view"

Where did I say anything about that?
>If I don't like your attitude, I'm not going to surrender. If you're acting like how you are now, than I'm most certainly not going to surrender.

Okay? "Acting like how you are now" implies that OP would already be angry *in game*. That is what my comment addresses, people who angry and rude, and then expect people to do them a favor by ending the game early for them. Why should my enjoyment be hampered by some dude with a short fuse?

"Than I'm most certainly"

the "Than" implies your choice is because of how he's acting, just trying to make him mad.

I think grammar wise, it's meant to be "Then", so my bad. Even then it still doesn't hold up. It's an X results in Y statement.

> If (X) you have a shitty, angry attitude and want to surrender then/than (Y) I will not surrender.

You're trying to imply that OP is not *already* angry, and that my not surrendering is to make him so. That's not the case. Of course my choice "is because of how he's acting", but that doesn't mean I'm trying to make him mad. I've already stated that if someone is already mad and angry, I won't surrender.

Why would I want to purposefully make someone mad? That defeats the entirety of my argument "I DONT LIKE MAD ANGRY PEOPLE."

No I know what it meant, no worries about that. 

If he's angry, and if you're down by that much, in this meta of all times, the chances of a comeback are low, and you know it.
Ah, but this is LEGAL trolling, that you can't get punished for.
Wow that's petty.

Never would I have thought expecting people to have a good attitude while playing the game would be considered "Petty." Does losing give you an excuse to be mean? To insult others? No, it doesn't, so excuse me for not doing the angry jerk a favor.
Well I don't like your attitude , If you're acting like how you are now , then I'm most certainly going to stay base playing cards with the shopkeeper :).
And I'll put forth my best effort regardless. How you decide to play the game is no issue to me, but when you choosing to not want to play involves me not playing as well, then we have a problem.

I can't blame them honestly, we're coming from a season or past seasons where a single team fight can mean a complete pushback taking a handfull of towers and an objective. However with the new season and the ability to snowball extremely quickly and potently the come backs are few and far between. So honestly don't blame them, blame riot for the paradigm shift they've implemented.

My longest game in 2017: 57 min 34 seconds:
Karma support (Comet)

Vs: Ezreal on Klepto, who ended game 29/8/32.

Karma: Ended game with 118k champ damage.

Entire base was gone by about 18 minutes because adc, jungle, top were all worthless.

I Spent entire game keeping all minion lanes out of base, and taking 2/3-1/2 of the opponent team's HP per Q over and over. They'd retreat. We'd farm. Was a constant mid push with an occasionally 1 trying to split push what was left of our base. 

But um.... late game comebacks are kind of my thing..... and I have over 7000 games under my belt in 4 seasons, so...... 

My highest mastery is a 1.7 million point Nami on my Season 5 account. But that doesn't matter :)

Not all games are as extreme comebacks as that one, but many are noteable. I can't count the number of games where a Zyra support = both a base clear AND a mid push and plant barriers prevent other team from initiating/reprising while our adcs poke a turret to death while it's occupied.

I'd say 1 in 6 games is a lost game comeback.

Funny.. because I hate getting teamed up with players like you. I can't count how many times I've had one person that whines constantly since champ select and spams the surrender button just because their lane lost, only for us to come back because we aren't playing against pros and people throw. Don't Q up for ranked if you don't enjoy the spirit of competition, that includes playing it out at your best even when the odds are stacked against you, because those are the most satisfying wins.

People don't realize the "let's just surrender" mindset is a self-fulfilling prophecy. You will lose winnable games because of that poor attitude

Sure, these kinds of people are annoying calling for surrendering at 6 minutes because "ah report top feed gg they 0-1", but OP said that they where down 3 inhibs and hadn't taken any objective themselves. That's something around a 10k gold deficit, maybe even more, with 0 control on the map, no dragons or baron. On top of that, to reach such a point, it probably means that the enemy team is far more skilled than you, to the point that in a even-gold-lead game, the chances of winning are low, let alone a 10k gold deficit. I can't blame him for wanting to surrender such a game.
